content.raw: It worries me a bit to bump a dependency in a minor/patch release, since it will at first break all builds downstream, but it looks like it's a [common practice](http://semver.org/#what-should-i-do-if-i-update-my-own-dependencies-without-changing-the-public-api). One thing we could do to alleviate this is to support both versions 2 and 3, but I'm ok with it the way it is.

content.raw:
Breaking all builds downstream, as I understand it, it would be not reasonable. If we have third party software built on top of sdformat4 it should keep working. 

If a system updates sdformat4 but that update requires the new version of the dependency present in the system, do you think that it will break existing code? Existing code relies on the sdformat4 libraries and sdformat4 libraries relies on whatever third party libraries it uses. As long as there is no ABI breakage, all should be ok. I could be perfectly wrong with the reasoning, but that was the one I used with this bump.

content.raw:
I don't think that it would be too much trouble to support ign-math2 or ign-math3 the point was try to migrate all gazebo8 dependencies to support just ign-math3 in order to avoid mixing of different ABIs. This will not be a problem for building the packages just using ign-math3.

For the people building from source, we are controlling the versions with this PR (requires ign-math3 installed in the system so the people need to have it in the system) and with a stricter requirement in gazebo8 (require sdformat4 > 4.3.0).

If we support ign-math2 and ign-math3 we open the door of being able to have a build from source of the next sdformat (4.3.0) with gazebo8 having other dependencies using ign-math3.
